s.text: I say anyone who writes a masterpiece does a service to literature, just as anyone who tries to make a work of art grist for their political mill does it a disservice.
I say anyone who writes a masterpiece does a service to literature, just as anyone who tries to make a work of art grist for their political mill does it a disservice.

And so we still scapegoat RN for all the sins of the era to avoid having to ask tough questions about what really happened to Indochina, and to America, when Hanoi and the Khmer Rouge were permitted to have their way with people whom we'd pledged to protect (and almost succeeded in protecting).

And so we still scapegoat RN for all the sins of the era to avoid having to ask tough questions about what really happened to Indochina, and to America, when Hanoi and the Khmer Rouge were permitted to have their way with people whom we'd pledged to protect (and almost succeeded in protecting).

It is also false to say that I ever embraced the Bible Code or am now a disappointed convert.
In fact, the central point of that paper, as I noted in the article, is that the criteria Prof.
Your article that posted late yesterday about the Bible code would not have been published if your reporter, or your editors, had taken the time to check out the facts.
All of us who are not religious think we know that the Bible code simply cannot be real.

Do you or do you not believe this is a legitimate reason for a commander-in-chief in the middle of a war he inherited to be frustrated, particularly when he was still signing 30-40 letters a week to the families of KIA?
Check out Lewis Sorley's new book about Vietnam, for instance.
